Create directory if it doesn't exist

Source: R/utils.R
create_dir_if_not_exists.Rd

Creates a directory if it doesn't exist, with optional recursive creation of parent directories.

Usage

create_dir_if_not_exists(dir_path, recursive = TRUE)

Arguments

dir_path

Character string specifying the directory path to create.

recursive

Logical indicating whether to create parent directories. Default is TRUE.

Value

Invisible NULL. The directory is created if it doesn't exist. The function returns the directory path invisibly.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Checks if the directory exists using dir.exists()

  2. Creates the directory if it doesn't exist using dir.create()

  3. Optionally creates parent directories if recursive is TRUE

This function is useful for:

  • Creating output directories for analysis results

  • Setting up directory structures for data processing

  • Ensuring directories exist before saving files

See also

dir.create for the base R function

Examples

create_dir_if_not_exists("./results/plots")
